name: Tsell Harim Hotel

reviews.text: Tzell Harim is a very basic and poorly maintained hotel.
reviews.title: Stay Away!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On booking explained to wait for confirmed email.
reviews.title: Careful...be sure you are CONFIRMED.

reviews.text: Next email looked like the confirmation.
reviews.title: Overpriced and a complete dump. AVOID!

likes.disliked: — it was so horrible for us.

reviews.text: We stayed here one night while touring Israel. This is a very dated hotel, but our rooms (we had a group in 4 rooms) were clean and quiet. The buffet meals that were included were adequate. The one nice feature was the pool.
reviews.title: it serves the purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only positive about this hotel is its location - right on the beach. However, the room was dirty and badly in need of updating. Graffiti in the closet with dates from 1999 and 2003.
reviews.title: Dirty and rooms need updating

reviews.text: Let´s make it clear at the very beginning: this hotel is not about luxury, or four star cleaniness, but about location and type of the building. There are very few (4?) hotels in Ein Bokek, that stand directly on the beach. Most of the luxury glass palaces do not. Out of these four, Tsell Harim is the only one bungalow style complex, where You can park the car inside next to Your door, and in case of second-floor rooms, enjoy privacy in enclosed teracess with high walls so that nobody sees You sunbathing or relaxing.Is there any other hotel like this in that area? No, You can´t find this in any other tower-style hotels there. Breakfasts were sufficient, swimming pool refreshingly cold and yes, the interiors were worn and not clean in many corners. Pricing was bellow the local level. The advantages clearly outweighted the flaws.
reviews.title: It´s about the location and style

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at the Dead Sea for one night to climb Masada and enjoy some time at the Dead Sea. To be fair, most of the better Ein Bokek resorts were booked up as it was near the holidays and it as a busy time. So we opted to take a room at the Tsell Harim Hotel, which had a nice pool picture, and a good location.
reviews.title: Yuk . . .

reviews.text: My, were we disappointed! It was so dirty that I could barely sleep. There were musty smelling mattresses and pillows, with no mattress pad, so the flimsy sheet was right on the dirty mattress.
reviews.title: cheap and basic,but not so bad

aka: Tsell Harim Hotel Dead Sea, Israel
